get.summary: Gets the OAuth 2.0 Metadata for automatic configuration of clients verifying dialog tokens.
get.description: This endpoint can be used by client integrations supporting automatic discovery of "OAuth 2.0 Authorization Server" metadata, enabling verification of dialog tokens issues by Dialogporten.

get.summary: Gets the JSON Web Key Set (JWKS) containing the public keys used to verify dialog token signatures
get.description: This endpoint can be used by client integrations supporting automatic discovery of "OAuth 2.0 Authorization Server" metadata, enabling verification of dialog tokens issues by Dialogporten.

get.summary: Gets a list of dialog transmissions
get.description: Gets the list of transmissions belonging to a dialog

200.description: Successfully returned the dialog transmission list.

401.description: Missing or invalid authentication token. Requires a Maskinporten-token with the scope "digdir:dialogporten.serviceprovider".

403.description: Unauthorized to get the supplied dialog (not owned by authenticated organization or has additional scope requirements defined in policy).

post.summary: Adds a transmission to a dialog
post.description:
The transmission is created with the given configuration. For more information see the documentation (link TBD).

Optimistic concurrency control is implemented using the If-Match header. Supply the Revision value from the GetDialog endpoint to ensure that the dialog is not modified/deleted by another request in the meantime.

401.description: Missing or invalid authentication token. Requires a Maskinporten-token with the scope "digdir:dialogporten.serviceprovider".

403.description: Unauthorized to create child entity for the given dialog (dialog not owned by authenticated organization or has additional scope requirements defined in service identifiers policy).

201.description: The UUID of the created the dialog transmission. A relative URL to the newly created activity is set in the "Location" header.

400.description: Validation error occured. See problem details for a list of errors.

404.description: The given dialog ID was not found or is already deleted.

412.description: The supplied If-Match header did not match the current Revision value for the dialog. The request was not applied.

422.description: Domain error occured. See problem details for a list of errors.

get.summary: Gets a single dialog transmission
get.description: Gets a single transmission belonging to a dialog. For more information see the documentation (link TBD).

401.description: Missing or invalid authentication token. Requires a Maskinporten-token with the scope "digdir:dialogporten.serviceprovider".

403.description: Unauthorized to get child entity for the given dialog (dialog not owned by authenticated organization or has additional scope requirements defined in service identifiers policy).

404.description: The given dialog ID was not found or was deleted, or the given transmission ID was not found.

get.summary: Gets all seen log records for a dialog
get.description: Gets all seen log records for a dialog. For more information see the documentation (link TBD).

401.description: Unauthorized

403.description: Forbidden

200.description: Successfully returned the dialog seen log records.

get.summary: Gets a single dialog seen log record
get.description: Gets a single dialog seen log record. For more information see the documentation (link TBD).

401.description: Unauthorized

403.description: Forbidden

200.description: Successfully returned the dialog seen log record.

put.description:
Replaces a given dialog with the supplied model. For more information see the documentation (link TBD).

Optimistic concurrency control is implemented using the If-Match header. Supply the Revision value from the GetDialog endpoint to ensure that the dialog is not modified/deleted by another request in the meantime.

401.description: Missing or invalid authentication token. Requires a Maskinporten-token with the scope "digdir:dialogporten.serviceprovider".

403.description: Unauthorized to update the supplied dialog (not owned by authenticated organization or has additional scope requirements defined in policy).

204.description: The dialog aggregate was updated successfully.

400.description: Validation error occured. See problem details for a list of errors.

404.description: The given dialog ID was not found or is already deleted.

412.description: The supplied If-Match header did not match the current Revision value for the dialog. The request was not applied.

422.description: Domain error occured. See problem details for a list of errors.

get.summary: Gets a single dialog
get.description:
Gets a single dialog aggregate. For more information see the documentation (link TBD).

Note that this operation may return deleted dialogs (see the field `DeletedAt`).

401.description: Missing or invalid authentication token. Requires a Maskinporten-token with the scope "digdir:dialogporten.serviceprovider".

403.description: Unauthorized to get the supplied dialog (not owned by authenticated organization or has additional scope requirements defined in policy).

404.description: The given dialog ID was not found or is already deleted.

delete.description:
Deletes a given dialog (soft delete). For more information see the documentation (link TBD).

Note that the dialog will still be available on the single details endpoint, but will have a deleted status. It will not appear on the list endpoint for either service owners nor end users.
If end users attempt to access the dialog via the details endpoint, they will get a 410 Gone response.

Optimistic concurrency control is implemented using the If-Match header. Supply the Revision value from the GetDialog endpoint to ensure that the dialog is not deleted by another request in the meantime.

401.description: Missing or invalid authentication token. Requires a Maskinporten-token with the scope "digdir:dialogporten.serviceprovider".

403.description: Unauthorized to delete the supplied dialog (not owned by authenticated organization or has additional scope requirements defined in policy).

204.description: The dialog aggregate was deleted successfully.

404.description: The given dialog ID was not found or is already deleted.

412.description: The supplied If-Match header did not match the current Revision value for the dialog. The request was not applied.

patch.description:
Patches a dialog aggregate with a RFC6902 JSON Patch document. The patch document must be a JSON array of RFC6902 operations.
See [https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6902](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6902) for more information.
            
Optimistic concurrency control is implemented using the If-Match header. Supply the Revision value from the GetDialog endpoint to ensure that the dialog is not modified/deleted by another request in the meantime.

400.description: Validation error occured. See problem details for a list of errors.

401.description: Missing or invalid authentication token. Requires a Maskinporten-token with the scope \"digdir:dialogporten.serviceprovider\"

403.description: Unauthorized to update a dialog for the given serviceResource (not owned by authenticated organization or has additional scope requirements defined in policy)

404.description: The given dialog ID was not found or is deleted

412.description: The supplied Revision does not match the current Revision of the dialog

422.description: Domain error occured. See problem details for a list of errors.

get.summary: Gets a list of dialogs
get.description:
Performs a search for dialogs, returning a paginated list of dialogs. For more information see the documentation (link TBD).

* All date parameters must contain explicit time zone. Example: 2023-10-27T10:00:00Z or 2023-10-27T10:00:00+01:00
* See "continuationToken" in the response for how to get the next page of results.
* hasNextPage will be set to true if there are more items to get.

parameters.name: serviceResource
parameters.description: Filter by one or more service resources

parameters.name: party
parameters.description: Filter by one or more owning parties

parameters.name: endUserId
parameters.description: Filter by end user id

parameters.name: extendedStatus
parameters.description: Filter by one or more extended statuses

parameters.name: externalReference
parameters.description: Filter by external reference

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Filter by status

parameters.name: createdAfter
parameters.description: Only return dialogs created after this date

parameters.name: createdBefore
parameters.description: Only return dialogs created before this date

parameters.name: updatedAfter
parameters.description: Only return dialogs updated after this date

parameters.name: updatedBefore
parameters.description: Only return dialogs updated before this date

parameters.name: dueAfter
parameters.description: Only return dialogs with due date after this date

parameters.name: dueBefore
parameters.description: Only return dialogs with due date before this date

parameters.name: visibleAfter
parameters.description: Only return dialogs with visible-from date after this date

parameters.name: visibleBefore
parameters.description: Only return dialogs with visible-from date before this date

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Search string for free text search. Will attempt to fuzzily match in all free text fields in the aggregate

parameters.name: searchLanguageCode
parameters.description: Limit free text search to texts with this language code, e.g. 'no', 'en'. Culture codes will be normalized to neutral language codes (ISO 639). Default: search all culture codes

parameters.name: continuationToken
parameters.description: Supply "continuationToken" for the response to get the next page of results, if hasNextPage is true

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit the number of results per page (1-1000, default: 100)

401.description: Missing or invalid authentication token. Requires a Maskinporten-token with the scope "digdir:dialogporten.serviceprovider.search".

post.description:
The dialog is created with the given configuration. For more information see the documentation (link TBD).

For detailed information on validation rules, see [the source for CreateDialogCommandValidator](https://github.com/digdir/dialogporten/blob/main/src/Digdir.Domain.Dialogporten.Application/Features/V1/ServiceOwner/Dialogs/Commands/Create/CreateDialogCommandValidator.cs)

401.description: Missing or invalid authentication token. Requires a Maskinporten-token with the scope "digdir:dialogporten.serviceprovider".

403.description: Unauthorized to create a dialog for the given serviceResource (not owned by authenticated organization or has additional scope requirements defined in policy).

201.description: The UUID of the created the dialog aggregate. A relative URL to the newly created activity is set in the "Location" header.

400.description: Validation error occured. See problem details for a list of errors.

422.description: Domain error occured. See problem details for a list of errors.

post.description:
Deletes a given dialog (hard delete). For more information see the documentation (link TBD).

Optimistic concurrency control is implemented using the If-Match header. Supply the Revision value from the GetDialog endpoint to ensure that the dialog is not deleted by another request in the meantime.

401.description: Missing or invalid authentication token. Requires a Maskinporten-token with the scope "digdir:dialogporten.serviceprovider".

403.description: Unauthorized to delete the supplied dialog (not owned by authenticated organization or has additional scope requirements defined in policy).

204.description: The dialog aggregate was deleted successfully.

404.description: The given dialog ID was not found or is already deleted.

412.description: The supplied If-Match header did not match the current Revision value for the dialog. The request was not applied.

get.summary: Returns a boolean value based on conditions used to determine if a notification is to be sent.

Performs a search for dialogs, returning a paginated list of dialogs. For more information see the documentation (link TBD).

* All date parameters must contain explicit time zone. Example: 2023-10-27T10:00:00Z or 2023-10-27T10:00:00+01:00

get.summary: Gets a single dialog
get.description: Gets a single dialog aggregate. For more information see the documentation (link TBD).

401.description: Missing or invalid authentication token. Requires a Maskinporten-token with the scope "digdir:dialogporten".

403.description: Unauthorized to get the supplied dialog (not owned by authenticated organization or has additional scope requirements defined in policy).

404.description: The given dialog ID was not found or is already deleted.

get.summary: Gets a list of dialog activities
get.description: Gets the list of activities belonging to a dialog

200.description: Successfully returned the dialog activity list.

401.description: Missing or invalid authentication token. Requires a Maskinporten-token with the scope "digdir:dialogporten".

403.description: Unauthorized to get the supplied dialog (not owned by authenticated organization or has additional scope requirements defined in policy).

get.summary: Gets a single dialog activity
get.description: Gets a single activity belonging to a dialog. For more information see the documentation (link TBD).

401.description: Missing or invalid authentication token. Requires a Maskinporten-token with the scope "digdir:dialogporten".

403.description: Unauthorized to get child entity for the given dialog (dialog not owned by authenticated organization or has additional scope requirements defined in service identifiers policy).

404.description: The given dialog ID was not found or was deleted, or the given activity ID was not found.

title.default: One or more validation errors occurred.

id.description:
The UUDIv7 of the action may be provided to support idempotent additions to the list of transmissions.
If not supplied a new UUIDv7 will be generated.

createdAt.description: If supplied, overrides the creating date and time for the transmission. If not supplied, current date/time will be used.

authorizationAttribute.description:
Contains an authorization resource attributeId, that can used in custom authorization rules in the XACML service
policy, which by default is the policy belonging to the service referred to by "serviceResource" in the dialog.
            
Can also be used to refer other service policies.

extendedType.description:
Arbitrary URI/URN describing a service-specific transmission type.
            
Refer to the service-specific documentation provided by the service owner for details (if in use).

relatedTransmissionId.description: Reference to any other transmission that this transmission is related to.

sender.description: The actor that sent the transmission.

actorType.description: The type of actor that sent the transmission.

actorName.description:
Specifies the name of the entity that sent the transmission. Mutually exclusive with ActorId. If ActorId
is supplied, the name will be automatically populated from the name registries.

actorId.description:
The identifier of the person or organization that sent the transmission. Mutually exclusive with ActorName.
Might be omitted if ActorType is "ServiceOwner".

title.description: The transmission title. Must be text/plain.

value.description: A list of localizations for the content

mediaType.description: Media type of the content (plaintext, Markdown). Can also indicate that the content is embeddable.

value.description: The localized text or URI reference

languageCode.description: The language code of the localization in ISO 639-1 format

id.description:
A self-defined UUIDv7 may be provided in order to support idempotent updates of attachments. If not supplied,
a new UUIDv7 will be generated.

displayName.description: The display name of the attachment that should be used in GUIs.

urls.description: The URLs associated with the attachment, each referring a different representation of the attachment.

id.description:
A self-defined UUIDv7 may be provided in order to support idempotent updates of attachment URLs. If not supplied,
a new UUIDv7 will be generated.

url.description: The fully qualified HTTPS URL of the attachment.

mediaType.description: The media type of the attachment.

consumerType.description: The type of consumer the URL is intended for.

progress.description:
Advisory indicator of progress, represented as 1-100 percentage value. 100% representing a dialog that has come
to a natural completion (successful or not).

extendedStatus.description:
Arbitrary string with a service-specific indicator of status, typically used to indicate a fine-grained state of
the dialog to further specify the "status" enum.

externalReference.description: Arbitrary string with a service-specific reference to an external system or service.

visibleFrom.description:
The timestamp when the dialog should be made visible for authorized end users. If not provided, the dialog will be
immediately available.

dueAt.description: The due date for the dialog. Dialogs past due date might be marked as such in frontends, but will still be available.

expiresAt.description:
The expiration date for the dialog. This is the last date when the dialog is available for the end user.
            
After this date is passed, the dialog will be considered expired and no longer available for the end user in any
API. If not supplied, the dialog will be considered to never expire. This field can be changed after creation.

status.description: The aggregated status of the dialog.

searchTags.description: A list of words (tags) that will be used in dialog search queries. Not visible in end-user DTO.

attachments.description: The attachments associated with the dialog (on an aggregate level)

transmissions.description:
The immutable list of transmissions associated with the dialog. When updating via PUT, any transmissions
added here will be appended to the existing list of transmissions.

guiActions.description: The GUI actions associated with the dialog. Should be used in browser-based interactive front-ends.

apiActions.description: The API actions associated with the dialog. Should be used in specialized, non-browser-based integrations.

activities.description:
An immutable list of activities associated with the dialog. When updating via PUT, any activities added here
will be appended to the existing list of activities.

title.description: The title of the dialog. Must be text/plain.

summary.description: A short summary of the dialog and its current state. Must be text/plain.

senderName.description: Overridden sender name. If not supplied, assume "org" as the sender name. Must be text/plain if supplied.

additionalInfo.description: Additional information about the dialog, this may contain Markdown.

extendedStatus.description: Used as the human-readable label used to describe the "ExtendedStatus" field. Must be text/plain.

mainContentReference.description: Front-channel embedded content. Used to dynamically embed content in the front-end from an external URL.

id.description:
A self-defined UUIDv7 may be provided in order to support idempotent updates of attachments. If not supplied,
a new UUIDv7 will be generated.

displayName.description: The display name of the attachment that should be used in GUIs.

urls.description: The URLs associated with the attachment, each referring a different representation of the attachment.

id.description:
A self-defined UUIDv7 may be provided in order to support idempotent updates of attachment URLs. If not supplied,
a new UUIDv7 will be generated.

url.description: The fully qualified HTTPS URL of the attachment.

mediaType.description: The media type of the attachment.

consumerType.description: The type of consumer the URL is intended for.

id.description:
The UUDIv7 of the action may be provided to support idempotent additions to the list of transmissions.
If not supplied a new UUIDv7 will be generated.

createdAt.description: If supplied, overrides the creating date and time for the transmission. If not supplied, current date/time will be used.

authorizationAttribute.description:
Contains an authorization resource attributeId, that can used in custom authorization rules in the XACML service
policy, which by default is the policy belonging to the service referred to by "serviceResource" in the dialog.
            
Can also be used to refer other service policies.

extendedType.description:
Arbitrary URI/URN describing a service-specific transmission type.
            
Refer to the service-specific documentation provided by the service owner for details (if in use).

relatedTransmissionId.description: Reference to any other transmission that this transmission is related to.

sender.description: The actor that sent the transmission.

id.description:
The UUDIv7 of the action may be provided to support idempotent additions to the list of actions. If not supplied,
a new UUIDv7 will be generated.

action.description: The action identifier for the action, corresponding to the "action" attributeId used in the XACML service policy,

url.description:
The fully qualified HTTPS URL of the action, to which the user will be redirected when the action is triggered. Will be set to
"urn:dialogporten:unauthorized" if the user is not authorized to perform the action.

authorizationAttribute.description:
Contains an authorization resource attributeId, that can used in custom authorization rules in the XACML service
policy, which by default is the policy belonging to the service referred to by "serviceResource" in the dialog.
            
Can also be used to refer other service policies.

isDeleteDialogAction.description:
Indicates whether the action results in the dialog being deleted. Used by frontends to implement custom UX
for delete actions.

httpMethod.description: The HTTP method that the frontend should use when redirecting the user.

priority.description:
Indicates a priority for the action, making it possible for frontends to adapt GUI elements based on action
priority.

title.description: The title of the action, should be short and in verb form. Must be text/plain.

prompt.description:
If there should be a prompt asking the user for confirmation before the action is executed,
this field should contain the prompt text.

id.description:
The UUDIv7 of the action may be provided to support idempotent additions to the list of API actions.
If not supplied a new UUIDv7 will be generated.

action.description:
String identifier for the action, corresponding to the "action" attributeId used in the XACML service policy,
which by default is the policy belonging to the service referred to by "serviceResource" in the dialog

authorizationAttribute.description:
Contains an authorization resource attributeId, that can used in custom authorization rules in the XACML service
policy, which by default is the policy belonging to the service referred to by "serviceResource" in the dialog.
            
Can also be used to refer other service policies.

endpoints.description: The endpoints associated with the action.

id.description:
The UUDIv7 of the action may be provided to support idempotent additions to the list of API action endpoints.
If not supplied a new UUIDv7 will be generated.

version.description: Arbitrary string indicating the version of the endpoint.

url.description: The fully qualified HTTPS URL of the API endpoint.

httpMethod.description: The HTTP method that the endpoint expects for this action.

documentationUrl.description:
Link to documentation for the endpoint, providing documentation for integrators. Should be a URL to a
human-readable page.

requestSchema.description:
Link to the request schema for the endpoint. Used to provide documentation for integrators.
Dialogporten will not validate information on this endpoint.

responseSchema.description:
Link to the response schema for the endpoint. Used to provide documentation for integrators.
Dialogporten will not validate information on this endpoint.

deprecated.description: Boolean indicating if the endpoint is deprecated.

sunsetAt.description:
Date and time when the endpoint will no longer function. Only set if the endpoint is deprecated. Dialogporten
will not enforce this date.

id.description:
The UUDIv7 of the action may be provided to support idempotent additions to the list of activities.
If not supplied a new UUIDv7 will be generated.

createdAt.description: If supplied, overrides the creating date and time for the transmission. If not supplied, current date/time will be used.

extendedType.description: Arbitrary URI/URN describing a service-specific transmission type.

relatedActivityId.description: The related activity identifier, if applicable. Must be present in the request body.

transmissionId.description:
If the activity is related to a particular transmission, this field will contain the transmission identifier.
Must be present in the request body.

performedBy.description: The actor that performed the activity.

description.description: Unstructured text describing the activity. Only set if the activity type is "Information".

actorType.description: What type of actor performed the activity.

actorName.description:
Specifies the name of the entity that performed the activity. Mutually exclusive with ActorId. If ActorId
is supplied, the name will be automatically populated from the name registries.

actorId.description:
The identifier of the person or organization that performed the activity. Mutually exclusive with ActorName.
Might be omitted if ActorType is "ServiceOwner".

hasNextPage.description: Whether there are more items available that can be fetched by supplying the continuation token

continuationToken.description: The continuation token to be used to fetch the next page of items

orderBy.description: The current sorting order of the items

id.description: The unique identifier for the in UUIDv7 format.

org.description: The service owner code representing the organization (service owner) related to this dialog.

serviceResource.description:
The service identifier for the service that the dialog is related to in URN-format.
This corresponds to a service resource in the Altinn Resource Registry.

party.description: The party code representing the organization or person that the dialog belongs to in URN format

progress.description:
Advisory indicator of progress, represented as 1-100 percentage value. 100% representing a dialog that has come
to a natural completion (successful or not).

guiAttachmentCount.description: The number of attachments in the dialog made available for browser-based frontends.

extendedStatus.description:
Arbitrary string with a service-specific indicator of status, typically used to indicate a fine-grained state of
the dialog to further specify the "status" enum.
            
Refer to the service-specific documentation provided by the service owner for details on the possible values (if
in use).

createdAt.description: The date and time when the dialog was created.

updatedAt.description: The date and time when the dialog was last updated.

dueAt.description: The due date for the dialog. This is the last date when the dialog is expected to be completed.

visibleFrom.description: The timestamp when the dialog will be made visible for authorized end users.

status.description: The aggregated status of the dialog.

latestActivity.description: The latest entry in the dialog's activity log.

seenSinceLastUpdate.description: The list of seen log entries for the dialog newer than the dialog ChangedAt date.

content.description: The content of the dialog in search results

id.description: The unique identifier for the activity in UUIDv7 format.

createdAt.description: The date and time when the activity was created.

extendedType.description:
An arbitrary string with a service-specific activity type.
            
Consult the service-specific documentation provided by the service owner for details (if in use).

relatedActivityId.description: The related activity identifier, if applicable. Must be present in current dialog.

transmissionId.description: If the activity is related to a particular transmission, this field will contain the transmission identifier.

performedBy.description: The actor that performed the activity.

description.description: Unstructured text describing the activity. Only set if the activity type is "Information".

actorType.description: What type of actor performed the activity.

actorName.description:
The name of the person or organization that performed the activity.
Only set if the actor type is "PartyRepresentative".

actorId.description:
The identifier of the person or organization that performed the activity.
May be omitted if ActorType is "ServiceOwner".

id.description: The unique identifier for the seen log entry in UUIDv7 format.

seenAt.description: The timestamp when the dialog revision was seen

seenBy.description: The actor that saw the dialog revision

isViaServiceOwner.description:
Flag indicating whether the seen log entry was created via the service owner.
            
This is used when the service owner uses the service owner API to implement its own frontend.

isCurrentEndUser.description: Flag indicating whether the seen log entry was created by the end user supplied in query.

actorName.description: The natural name of the person/business that saw the dialog revision.

actorId.description: The identifier of the person/business that saw the dialog revision.

title.description: The title of the dialog. Always text/plain.

summary.description: A short summary of the dialog and its current state. Always text/plain.

senderName.description: Overridden sender name. If not supplied, assume "org" as the sender name. Always text/plain.

extendedStatus.description: Used as the human-readable label used to describe the "ExtendedStatus" field. Always text/plain.

id.description: The unique identifier for the in UUIDv7 format.

revision.description: The unique identifier for the revision in UUIDv4 format.

org.description: The service owner code representing the organization (service owner) related to this dialog.

serviceResource.description:
The service identifier for the service that the dialog is related to in URN-format.
This corresponds to a service resource in the Altinn Resource Registry.

party.description: The party code representing the organization or person that the dialog belongs to in URN format

progress.description:
Advisory indicator of progress, represented as 1-100 percentage value. 100% representing a dialog that has come
to a natural completion (successful or not).

extendedStatus.description:
Arbitrary string with a service-specific indicator of status, typically used to indicate a fine-grained state of
the dialog to further specify the "status" enum.
            
Refer to the service-specific documentation provided by the service owner for details on the possible values (if
in use).

externalReference.description:
Arbitrary string with a service-specific reference to an external system or service.
            
Refer to the service-specific documentation provided by the service owner for details (if in use).

deletedAt.description: If deleted, the date and time when the deletion was performed.

visibleFrom.description: The timestamp when the dialog will be made visible for authorized end users.

dueAt.description: The due date for the dialog. Dialogs past due date might be marked as such in frontends, but will still be available.

expiresAt.description:
The expiration date for the dialog. This is the last date when the dialog is available for the end user.
            
After this date is passed, the dialog will be considered expired and no longer available for the end user in any
API. If not supplied, the dialog will be considered to never expire. This field can be changed by the service
owner after the dialog has been created.

createdAt.description: The date and time when the dialog was created.

updatedAt.description: The date and time when the dialog was last updated.

status.description: The aggregated status of the dialog.

searchTags.description: The list of words (tags) that will be used in dialog search queries. Not visible in end-user DTO.

attachments.description: The attachments associated with the dialog (on an aggregate level)

transmissions.description: The immutable list of transmissions associated with the dialog

guiActions.description: The GUI actions associated with the dialog. Should be used in browser-based interactive front-ends.

apiActions.description: The API actions associated with the dialog. Should be used in specialized, non-browser-based integrations.

activities.description: An immutable list of activities associated with the dialog.

seenSinceLastUpdate.description: The list of seen log entries for the dialog newer than the dialog ChangedAt date.

title.description: The title of the dialog. Always text/plain.

summary.description: A short summary of the dialog and its current state. Always text/plain.

senderName.description: Overridden sender name. If not supplied, assume "org" as the sender name. Always text/plain.

additionalInfo.description: Additional information about the dialog, this may contain Markdown.

extendedStatus.description: Used as the human-readable label used to describe the "ExtendedStatus" field. Always text/plain.

mainContentReference.description: Front-channel embedded content. Used to dynamically embed content in the front-end from an external URL.

id.description: The unique identifier for the attachment in UUIDv7 format.

displayName.description: The display name of the attachment that should be used in GUIs.

urls.description: The URLs associated with the attachment, each referring a different representation of the attachment.

id.description: The unique identifier for the attachment URL in UUIDv7 format.

url.description: The fully qualified HTTPS URL of the attachment.

mediaType.description: The media type of the attachment.

consumerType.description: What type of consumer the URL is intended for.

id.description: The unique identifier for the transmission in UUIDv7 format.

createdAt.description: The date and time when the transmission was created.

authorizationAttribute.description:
Contains an authorization resource attributeId, that can used in custom authorization rules in the XACML service
policy, which by default is the policy belonging to the service referred to by "serviceResource" in the dialog.
            
Can also be used to refer other service policies.

isAuthorized.description: Flag indicating if the authenticated user supplied in query is authorized for this transmission.

extendedType.description:
Arbitrary URI/URN describing a service-specific transmission type.
            
Refer to the service-specific documentation provided by the service owner for details (if in use).

relatedTransmissionId.description: Reference to any other transmission that this transmission is related to.

sender.description: The actor that sent the transmission.

actorType.description: The type of actor that sent the transmission.

actorName.description: The name of the person or organization that sent the transmission.

actorId.description: The identifier of the person or organization that sent the transmission.

id.description: The unique identifier for the attachment in UUIDv7 format.

displayName.description: The display name of the attachment that should be used in GUIs.

urls.description: The URLs associated with the attachment, each referring a different representation of the attachment.

url.description:
The fully qualified HTTPS URL of the attachment. Will be set to "urn:dialogporten:unauthorized" if the user is
not authorized to access the transmission.

mediaType.description: The media type of the attachment.

consumerType.description: The type of consumer the URL is intended for.

id.description: The unique identifier for the action in UUIDv7 format.

action.description: The action identifier for the action, corresponding to the "action" attributeId used in the XACML service policy,

url.description: The fully qualified HTTPS URL of the action, to which the user will be redirected when the action is triggered.

authorizationAttribute.description:
Contains an authorization resource attributeId, that can used in custom authorization rules in the XACML service
policy, which by default is the policy belonging to the service referred to by "serviceResource" in the dialog.
            
Can also be used to refer other service policies.

isAuthorized.description: Whether the user, if supplied in query, is authorized to perform the action.

isDeleteDialogAction.description:
Indicates whether the action results in the dialog being deleted. Used by frontends to implement custom UX
for delete actions.

priority.description:
Indicates a priority for the action, making it possible for frontends to adapt GUI elements based on action
priority.

httpMethod.description: The HTTP method that the frontend should use when redirecting the user.

title.description: The title of the action, should be short and in verb form. Always text/plain.

prompt.description:
If there should be a prompt asking the user for confirmation before the action is executed,
this field should contain the prompt text.

id.description: The unique identifier for the action in UUIDv7 format.

action.description:
String identifier for the action, corresponding to the "action" attributeId used in the XACML service policy,
which by default is the policy belonging to the service referred to by "serviceResource" in the dialog

authorizationAttribute.description:
Contains an authorization resource attributeId, that can used in custom authorization rules in the XACML service
policy, which by default is the policy belonging to the service referred to by "serviceResource" in the dialog.
            
Can also be used to refer other service policies.

isAuthorized.description: True if the authenticated user (set in query) is authorized for this action.

endpoints.description: The endpoints associated with the action.

id.description: The unique identifier for the endpoint in UUIDv7 format.

version.description:
Arbitrary string indicating the version of the endpoint.
            
Consult the service-specific documentation provided by the service owner for details (if in use).

url.description: The fully qualified HTTPS URL of the API endpoint.

httpMethod.description: The HTTP method that the endpoint expects for this action.

documentationUrl.description:
Link to service provider documentation for the endpoint. Used for service owners to provide documentation for
integrators. Should be a URL to a human-readable page.

requestSchema.description:
Link to the request schema for the endpoint. Used by service owners to provide documentation for integrators.
Dialogporten will not validate information on this endpoint.

responseSchema.description:
Link to the response schema for the endpoint. Used for service owners to provide documentation for integrators.
Dialogporten will not validate information on this endpoint.

deprecated.description: Boolean indicating if the endpoint is deprecated. Integrators should migrate to endpoints with a higher version.

sunsetAt.description:
Date and time when the service owner has indicated that endpoint will no longer function. Only set if the endpoint
is deprecated. Dialogporten will not enforce this date.

id.description: The unique identifier for the activity in UUIDv7 format.

createdAt.description: The date and time when the activity was created.

extendedType.description:
An arbitrary URI/URN with a service-specific activity type.
            
Consult the service-specific documentation provided by the service owner for details (if in use).

relatedActivityId.description: The related activity identifier, if applicable. Must be present in current dialog.

transmissionId.description: If the activity is related to a particular transmission, this field will contain the transmission identifier.

performedBy.description: The actor that performed the activity.

description.description: Unstructured text describing the activity. Only set if the activity type is "Information".

actorType.description: What type of actor performed the activity.

actorName.description:
The name of the person or organization that performed the activity.
Only set if the actor type is "PartyRepresentative".

actorId.description:
The identifier of the person or organization that performed the activity.
May be omitted if ActorType is "ServiceOwner".

id.description: The unique identifier for the seen log entry in UUIDv7 format.

seenAt.description: The timestamp when the dialog revision was seen

seenBy.description: The actor that saw the dialog revision

isViaServiceOwner.description:
Flag indicating whether the seen log entry was created via the service owner.
            
This is used when the service owner uses the service owner API to implement its own frontend.

isCurrentEndUser.description: Flag indicating whether the seen log entry was created by the current end user, if provided in query

actorName.description: The natural name of the person/business that saw the dialog revision.

actorId.description: The identifier of the person/business that saw the dialog revision.

id.description: A self-defined UUIDv7 may be provided in order to support idempotent creation of dialogs. If not provided, a new UUIDv7 will be generated.

serviceResource.description:
The service identifier for the service that the dialog is related to in URN-format.
This corresponds to a resource in the Altinn Resource Registry, which the authenticated organization
must own, ie. be listed as the "competent authority" in the Resource Registry entry.

party.description: The party code representing the organization or person that the dialog belongs to in URN format

progress.description:
Advisory indicator of progress, represented as 1-100 percentage value. 100% representing a dialog that has come
to a natural completion (successful or not).

extendedStatus.description:
Arbitrary string with a service-specific indicator of status, typically used to indicate a fine-grained state of
the dialog to further specify the "status" enum.

externalReference.description: Arbitrary string with a service-specific reference to an external system or service.

visibleFrom.description:
The timestamp when the dialog should be made visible for authorized end users. If not provided, the dialog will be
immediately available.

dueAt.description: The due date for the dialog. Dialogs past due date might be marked as such in frontends, but will still be available.

expiresAt.description:
The expiration date for the dialog. This is the last date when the dialog is available for the end user.
            
After this date is passed, the dialog will be considered expired and no longer available for the end user in any
API. If not supplied, the dialog will be considered to never expire. This field can be changed after creation.

createdAt.description:
If set, will override the date and time when the dialog is set as created. If not supplied, current date/time
will be used.

updatedAt.description:
If set, will override the date and time when the dialog is set as last updated. If not supplied, current date/time
will be used.

status.description: The aggregated status of the dialog.

searchTags.description: A list of words (tags) that will be used in dialog search queries. Not visible in end-user DTO.

attachments.description: The attachments associated with the dialog (on an aggregate level)

transmissions.description: The immutable list of transmissions associated with the dialog

guiActions.description: The GUI actions associated with the dialog. Should be used in browser-based interactive front-ends.

apiActions.description: The API actions associated with the dialog. Should be used in specialized, non-browser-based integrations.

activities.description: An immutable list of activities associated with the dialog.

title.description: The title of the dialog. Must be text/plain.

summary.description: A short summary of the dialog and its current state. Must be text/plain.

senderName.description: Overridden sender name. If not supplied, assume "org" as the sender name. Must be text/plain if supplied.

additionalInfo.description: Additional information about the dialog, this may contain Markdown.

extendedStatus.description: Used as the human-readable label used to describe the "ExtendedStatus" field. Must be text/plain.

mainContentReference.description: Front-channel embedded content. Used to dynamically embed content in the front-end from an external URL.

displayName.description: The display name of the attachment that should be used in GUIs.

urls.description: The URLs associated with the attachment, each referring a different representation of the attachment.

url.description: The fully qualified HTTPS URL of the attachment.

mediaType.description: The media type of the attachment.

consumerType.description: The type of consumer the URL is intended for.

id.description: A self-defined UUIDv7 may be provided in order to support idempotent creation of transmissions. If not provided, a new UUIDv7 will be generated.

createdAt.description: If supplied, overrides the creating date and time for the transmission. If not supplied, current date/time will be used.

authorizationAttribute.description:
Contains an authorization resource attributeId, that can used in custom authorization rules in the XACML service
policy, which by default is the policy belonging to the service referred to by "serviceResource" in the dialog.
            
Can also be used to refer other service policies.

extendedType.description:
Arbitrary URI/URN describing a service-specific transmission type.
            
Refer to the service-specific documentation provided by the service owner for details (if in use).

relatedTransmissionId.description: Reference to any other transmission that this transmission is related to.

sender.description: The actor that sent the transmission.

actorType.description: The type of actor that sent the transmission.

actorName.description:
Specifies the name of the entity that sent the transmission. Mutually exclusive with ActorId. If ActorId
is supplied, the name will be automatically populated from the name registries.

actorId.description:
The identifier of the person or organization that sent the transmission. Mutually exclusive with ActorName.
Might be omitted if ActorType is "ServiceOwner".

url.description: The fully qualified HTTPS URL of the attachment.

consumerType.description: The type of consumer the URL is intended for.

prompt.description:
If there should be a prompt asking the user for confirmation before the action is executed,

String identifier for the action, corresponding to the "action" attributeId used in the XACML service policy,

endpoints.description: The endpoints associated with the action.

version.description: Arbitrary string indicating the version of the endpoint.

url.description: The fully qualified HTTPS URL of the API endpoint.

httpMethod.description: The HTTP method that the endpoint expects for this action.

documentationUrl.description:
Link to documentation for the endpoint, providing documentation for integrators. Should be a URL to a
human-readable page.

requestSchema.description:
Link to the request schema for the endpoint. Used to provide documentation for integrators.
Dialogporten will not validate information on this endpoint.

responseSchema.description:
Link to the response schema for the endpoint. Used to provide documentation for integrators.
Dialogporten will not validate information on this endpoint.

deprecated.description: Boolean indicating if the endpoint is deprecated.

sunsetAt.description:
Date and time when the endpoint will no longer function. Only set if the endpoint is deprecated. Dialogporten
will not enforce this date.

id.description: A self-defined UUIDv7 may be provided in order to support idempotent creation of activities. If not provided, a new UUIDv7 will be generated.

createdAt.description: If supplied, overrides the creating date and time for the transmission. If not supplied, current date/time will be used.

extendedType.description: Arbitrary URI/URN describing a service-specific transmission type.

relatedActivityId.description: The related activity identifier, if applicable. Must be present in the request body.

transmissionId.description:
If the activity is related to a particular transmission, this field will contain the transmission identifier.
Must be present in the request body.

performedBy.description: The actor that performed the activity.

description.description: Unstructured text describing the activity. Only set if the activity type is "Information".

actorType.description: What type of actor performed the activity.

actorName.description:
Specifies the name of the entity that performed the activity. Mutually exclusive with ActorId. If ActorId
is supplied, the name will be automatically populated from the name registries.

actorId.description:
The identifier of the person or organization that performed the activity. Mutually exclusive with ActorName.
Might be omitted if ActorType is "ServiceOwner".

id.description:
The UUDIv7 of the action may be provided to support idempotent additions to the list of activities.
If not supplied a new UUIDv7 will be generated.

createdAt.description: If supplied, overrides the creating date and time for the transmission. If not supplied, current date/time will be used.

extendedType.description: Arbitrary URI/URN describing a service-specific transmission type.

relatedActivityId.description: The related activity identifier, if applicable. Must be present in the request body.

transmissionId.description:
If the activity is related to a particular transmission, this field will contain the transmission identifier.
Must be present in the request body.

performedBy.description: The actor that performed the activity.

description.description: Unstructured text describing the activity. Only set if the activity type is "Information".

hasNextPage.description: Whether there are more items available that can be fetched by supplying the continuation token

continuationToken.description: The continuation token to be used to fetch the next page of items

orderBy.description: The current sorting order of the items

action.description:
String identifier for the action, corresponding to the "action" attributeId used in the XACML service policy,
which by default is the policy belonging to the service referred to by "serviceResource" in the dialog

authorizationAttribute.description:
Contains an authorization resource attributeId, that can used in custom authorization rules in the XACML service
policy, which by default is the policy belonging to the service referred to by "serviceResource" in the dialog.
            
Can also be used to refer other service policies.

isAuthorized.description:
True if the authenticated user is authorized for this action. If not, the action will not be available
and all endpoints will be replaced with a fixed placeholder.

endpoints.description: The endpoints associated with the action.

id.description: The unique identifier for the endpoint in UUIDv7 format.

version.description:
Arbitrary string indicating the version of the endpoint.
            
Consult the service-specific documentation provided by the service owner for details (if in use).

url.description:
The fully qualified HTTPS URL of the API endpoint. Will be set to "urn:dialogporten:unauthorized" if the user is
not authorized to perform the action.

httpMethod.description: The HTTP method that the endpoint expects for this action.

documentationUrl.description:
Link to service provider documentation for the endpoint. Used for service owners to provide documentation for
integrators. Should be a URL to a human-readable page.

requestSchema.description:
Link to the request schema for the endpoint. Used by service owners to provide documentation for integrators.
Dialogporten will not validate information on this endpoint.

responseSchema.description:
Link to the response schema for the endpoint. Used for service owners to provide documentation for integrators.
Dialogporten will not validate information on this endpoint.

deprecated.description: Boolean indicating if the endpoint is deprecated. Integrators should migrate to endpoints with a higher version.

sunsetAt.description:
Date and time when the service owner has indicated that endpoint will no longer function. Only set if the endpoint
is deprecated. Dialogporten will not enforce this date.

id.description: The unique identifier for the activity in UUIDv7 format.

createdAt.description: The date and time when the activity was created.

extendedType.description:
An arbitrary URI/URN with a service-specific activity type.
            
Consult the service-specific documentation provided by the service owner for details (if in use).

relatedActivityId.description: The related activity identifier, if applicable. Must be present in current dialog.

transmissionId.description: If the activity is related to a particular transmission, this field will contain the transmission identifier.

performedBy.description: The actor that performed the activity.

description.description: Unstructured text describing the activity. Only set if the activity type is "Information".

actorType.description: What type of actor performed the activity.

actorName.description:
The name of the person or organization that performed the activity.
Only set if the actor type is "PartyRepresentative".

actorId.description:
The identifier of the person or organization that performed the activity.
May be omitted if ActorType is "ServiceOwner".

id.description: The unique identifier for the seen log entry in UUIDv7 format.

seenAt.description: The timestamp when the dialog revision was seen

seenBy.description: The actor that saw the dialog revision

isViaServiceOwner.description:
Flag indicating whether the seen log entry was created via the service owner.
            
This is used when the service owner uses the service owner API to implement its own frontend.

isCurrentEndUser.description: Flag indicating whether the seen log entry was created by the current end user.

actorName.description: The natural name of the person/business that saw the dialog revision.

actorId.description: The identifier of the person/business that saw the dialog revision.

JWTBearerAuth.description: Enter a JWT token to authorize the requests...
